reviews.review_msg: Yuyu was my instructor for another class and my T.A for this one. She's really caring and gives good and detailed feedback . She's also very approachable and accessible outside of class as well.

This guy is insufferable. He rambles about nonsense unrelated to class material and won't even get past the title lecture slide until an hour into the lecture. He talks about controversial topics that make everyone uncomfortable and is condescending when you don't share the same viewpoints as him.

Steve certaintly shocked everyone in class every lecture by the things he would say. Although he discusses controversial topics all the time, it somehow makes the class go by fast. His grading criteria is very vague, so I would def ask him a lot of questions.

He loves talking about unrelated stuff. I still don't get how some topic is related to marketing and why Steve keeps bringing it up. The ads he shows in class are kind of weird too. The two group assignments were unclear in terms of grading, and the instructions were also unclear. If you can, just avoid this him.

Gets really wrapped up in his own politics. Spent like 30 minutes arguing that the statement "From the river to the sea" was antisemitic, the dude is experiencing crazyyyyy cognitive dissonance. If you wanna take a lecture from a zionist go ahead.

If you want to feel uncomfortable for 3 hours then this is the class. He loves to revolve discussions around controversial topics and will call on people if no one answers. If you answer, he'll make you feel bad about it if it's wrong. Some topics in the class are actually interesting and group papers are worth a lot and super unclear.
Steve is no easygoing professor. Get ready to read many articles and be prepared for group assignments that are not easy. He is a tough grader on the assignments, the final is worth 40%.

Some of the other reviews are accurate in terms of his sense of humor but overall he knows how to make a 3 hour lecture pass by quick. There was 2 group papers worth 25% each, 40% final and 10% participation. Groups were random and there was no peer evaluation at all, although his sense of humor is debatable, he does care about students in a way.

The class content itself is fine, but Steven is just rude and unprofessional. He often makes comments about groups of people he dislikes during class (millennials, arts students, and colleagues without naming names) which isn't relevant to class material and just makes the environment uncomfortable. His demeanour is very unapproachable.
Worst prob so far. Really ambiguous term papers and he really has a kick our of making fun of students who try to participate in class. How is this guy even teaching in beedie?

Most of the reviews nail the assessment of him and the class. Overall terrible experience. You cannot select groups and then if there's any problems with your group, he expects ALL other team members to agree with you for him to take action (which makes no sense). On top of that, unclear projects and grading doesn't make sense.

Taking this class online consists of Steve posting a confusing word document of things he would say if the class was in person. He has no lectures and expects students to read a 20-page word doc of his notes. This is just lazy teaching. The group project is also extremely unclear. He sends out emails the contradict what he says on the syllabus

Great prof and really kind person. His exam is writing based, unlike most marketing courses. Questions are things discussed in class, and represent "large ideas". The group project is hit or miss so BE VERY CAREFUL WHEN FORMING YOUR GROUP
Very unclear with term projects. If you ask him to explain the marking rubric he will tell you it is self explanatory and to read it again. Not helpful at all. Doesn't use Canvas.

Steve is not a good prof, this is my last semester at SFU and can say hands down that he is the worst prof I have ever had. He is tough grader with unclear expectations and feedback. He makes you feel dumb in class when he expects participation but no one does. Not sure if you even can avoid him, but do try.

He seems like he is really passionate about the subject but his total organization of the course is awful. 2 group papers with very unclear criteria and a final that is only 4 specific long answer questions where he provides no direction on where to study. Not a good exam to test your full knowledge of the course. Save yourself the frustration.

Lectures are interesting and class goes by fast but I have lots of complaints about BUS 347 with him: He doesn't use Canvas so prepare for dozens and dozens and dozens of confusing emails. Group papers are a huge pain in the ass and the criteria is confusing. No idea how study for his final since what he wants us to know is quite unclear.

Steve encourages you to ask him for help but does not give useful information on what he wants. He'll only tell you everything you did wrong after he's given you a bad mark. His slides rarely match what he talks about in class & doesn't covers much of the textbook. Passionate speaker, but lectures did not help much with learning course material.

He isn't nearly as bad as this thread makes him to be. He is passionate about the materials, however, he does often veer off track. Definitely read the book, it'll provide you with more concrete concepts. My biggest tip for the assignments, try to include things he discusses in class, whether it be Trump, Virgin Mobile, or any other brand/concept.

Steve is a good prof. He gives a lot of feedback and really cares about the subject. He will stare at the class awkwardly waiting for an answer if he asks a question, and he will crack a lot of funny jokes. Consumer Behaviour isn't the place for politics, despite whatever disgusting EO Trump signed that day.

An utterly incorrigible display of ineptitude. Kates' lectures served as little more than a personal venue for dissemination of his distasteful anecdotes; by his own admission, his crowning achievement is covertly relieving himself into an empty soda can and concealing the act. Inconsistent and whimsical when grading; success is a game of chance.

Steve is smart, and knows about the subject area, but he has personal issues that he keeps bringing up in class. He'll get annoyed if no one participates in his discussions and just stand there waiting to do it. Rarely gets through all lecture slides so expect to do your own reading. Group project  2 papers, and he has high expectations. Not chill

I took his class 2 semesters ago. He is extremely condescending and disrespectful in comments on your assignments. When you go ask for help and guidance on an assignment he will give you none. Then when you get your mark back you will be surprised as he says it doesn't meet his expectations and it is a C grade. DO NOT TAKE IT WITH HIM, trust me.

Steve Kates is awesome -- as long as you are not easily offended. He is a funny and engaging professor that makes BUS347 interesting and fun. The class is pretty easy as long as you do the work. If you are confused by his wording, go to his office hours. He is very helpful one-on-one.

PROS: Made the class interesting. Off colour jokes, mostly funny. Encouraged students to ask questions. CONS: Very biased marker. Grades can be dominated by his emotions at the time. COURSE: make sure your TA is legit because he/she will be the one marking your final. We had one that boosted his friends' final paper.

Worst teacher I have ever had, hands down. The syllabus makes no sense, his expectations are totally unclear and he's a complete jerk. He goes on offensive rants that have nothing to do with the class. Don't even bother going to class because the lectures are useless. Keep in contact with the TA the whole time because that is the only way to pass.

hands down. the absolute WORST teacher at SFU. the course has the potential to be incredibly interesting but this teacher just DESTROYED it. marking is subjective, writing is illegible, comments are often inappropriate, gives TOO much information on his personal life too... AVOID THIS TEACHER AT ALL COSTS. the TA Nate on the other hand - AN ANGEL!

If you have any self respect for yourself, don't go through the stress of taking a course with him!!! Incredibly arrogant and cynical, and does not provide direction when you approach him for help. Instructions are very vague!! I'm only surviving because of the awesome TA...

Don't waste your time. He is too caught up with his own opinions. If you approach him with questions, he'll beat around the bush, and is inconsistent with his marking. He'll OK one idea, and destroy while marking. BE CAREFUL if you have no other choice!
Anxious, confused, disorganized.  This class was not a constructive experience.
She is one of the best bus profs i have ever had. she makes the learning so much interesting. her class is worth going. exams and grading is fair. strongly recommend you take this class with her.
Zahra is bomb! She is a fun professor who actually teaches you something. She is very fair, knows her stuff, and very helpful. Worth going to class she's a cool prof

This was actually the first business class I looked forward to during my entire time at SFU, very easy to participate in her class as she was able to make the classroom atmosphere welcoming to anyone that had input on certain topics. Also very knowledgable on all topics, no confusion at all during classes.

Awesome prof.  You could tell she was really interested in marketing and her interest rubbed off on everyone in the class.  Had interesting discussions in the class and she encourages questions if you dont understand.  Really approachable for extra help.  Exams and assignments are very fair.Excellent professor and I recommend taking a class wit her

Loved this professor! She's brilliant and she has so much real work experience that she shares with the class.  She really cares about her students and makes learning the material interesting and fun! She takes concepts from the book and helps us apply it to ourselves which facilitates learning. Definately Definately Recommeneded!!

Awesome prof. Very interactive class, lots of fun and somehow you acutally learn too! Projects were lots of work, but when you look back at it, they were pretty fun. Wish there were more profs like her on campus. Definitely recommend to take one Bus class with her.

Amazing Prof! She's Brilliant and I have never seen a prof know their stuff better than her- she just glances and the notes and then goes on and on about each topic just from memory! She makes the material interesting and really engages the students into the lecture! Loved her!!

Judy means well and cares for her students to learn. Despite her lack of skill with technology, she is very educated on Consumer Behaviour and has many insights. She often asked for feedback on how to improve her lectures and exams. Exams are heavy on textbook material, MC, T/F and short answer.

Judy is old-fashioned and sometimes arrogant. Very vague instructions and grading for assignments. She is not great with technology (Fair since she's old). Make sure you show up to every class and answer lots of questions. BUS347 with Judy has been the worst class I have ever experienced in Beedie. Good luck if you are enrolled in her classes.

She is such a great and caring prof. Brought interesting topics during lectures. Gave a cookie to each student as a treat after the midterm. Could've touched on the required textbook more extensively.

Judy is a pretty chill prof. She isn't good with tech, none of our grades were posted on canvas, and she is pretty disorganized. There is a midterm (25%) average was 60, individual presentation (25%) and final (40%). Have to read the textbook to do good on exams. Don't learn anything in lectures, but she has some fun stories about her travels.
Unclear due dates and lecture heavy. Not well with canvas either. Could have a bad attitude towards students depending on her mood. Awful experience.

Avoid this professor at all costs! Heavy group assignments with no sense of direction; if asked for, you are asked to "figure it out yourself". The professor is unaware of the course materials and deliverables herself.
Shes good, but her feedback isnt always good. However, exam is SO easy its actually an easy A. Overall good prof
Bad feedback, bad attitude towards students. Can't answer students questions properly. Honestly worst prof I had
Extremely easy and fair midterm and final. There's one paper but no grading criteria for it, and one individual presentation 20 minutes. No group work. Overall recommend.

I learned more from the textbook than from her (which is funny because she wrote the textbook). Lectures were long and useless because she didn't explain anything and thought it was all 'common sense'.  Read the textbook to get a good grade and attend lectures (where she picks on everyone) on or fail.
Old fashioned and nonchalant. Do not take her course if you expect feedback and development on your work. Stick to the textbook and good luck finding any value in her common sense lectures.
Great prof! She does pick on you if she knows your name but that gets you to pay attention. She tries to make a dull class interesting.
Took her class in 2006 and it made me hate marketing forever. What is it with " no food allowed", the class was during the lunch time...

She is an old fashioned individual teaching a cutting-edge subject. She is slightly arrogant, but .. she is a prof! Memorize the text, show up to tutorials, pwn the presentation and make sure that you don't wear a hat ;)

You really need to go to the lectures, or she will definately not like you.  She calls on students constantly, so read the text before lectures.  She tells you what's going to be on the exam, but there is other stuff on there, so read everything.
A no nonsense approach.  Likes you to be on time and pay constant attention
she insists only her answers are right. others that different from heres are wrong or " well not quite right". i don't like her attitudes. i will never take her course again. such a nightmare

well, i don't really like her. she asks broad questions for short answers in the midterm then expects you to answer the terminologies she expects you do, but we are not psych and there weren't enough time to finish all five short answers. and she calls u to answer the questions. plus no food or hat in the class, seems back to kindengarten.
No Comments
To do well in this course, memorize the textbook. The end.
very interesting class if you want a career in marketing.  prof is well organized but doesn't cover everything in the book.
great class, she's good at her course, don't miss lectures and you're ok
good class, lots of neat videos.  Make sure you don't miss lectures
tough prof, come to class on time, do not wear a hat.  She can be very helpful one on one
No Comments
The class isn't hard. Do all the readings and go to lecture. Prepare to have lots of discussions. She can be moody and rude to students, watch out. Put your hand up to speak.
She wrote the text book. eh, She's knowlegale. However, her attitude is too bad. Her personality is worse!
Incredibly challenging but very entertaining. He makes his lectures so good that it is hard to not pay attention. He also has humor like Dave Chappelle incredibly fun dude.
